title: Sri Lanka plans elephant corridors to curb human-elephant conflict - report
byline: Sri Lanka is planning to establish five elephant corridors in its north central province to reduce human-elephant conflicts, according to media reports on Sunday.

title: Three killed in clash between rival illicit liquor distillers
byline: Three persons are reported dead following a clash between two rival groups of illicit liquor distillers at Mamadala in Ambalantota this evening.

title: Grade 11 Term Tests in NCP schools resume after alleged paper leak
byline: The Grade 11 Term Tests in all government schools within the North-Central Province (NCP), which were suspended in January, will resume today (Feb. 03).

title: Mainly fair weather expected to prevail today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Galle, Matara, Kalutara and Rathnapura districts in the evening or night today (03).

title: Defense Ministry denies claims of SLAF aircraft use during President’s Jaffna visit
byline: The Ministry of Defense has issued a statement refuting social media claims that three Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) aircraft were used during President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s recent visit to Jaffna.

title: Govt. allocates Rs. 90 billion for public sector salary increments?
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala states that an amount of Rs. 90 billion has been allocated from the 2025 Budget to increase the salaries of the public sector employees.

title: Kanye West’s wife Bianca Censori is completely naked at Grammys 2025
byline: All the biggest names in music have hit the red carpet for the Grammy Awards in Los Angeles.

title: Prominent businessman Harry Jayawardena passes away
byline: Prominent Sri Lankan industrialist and businessman Deshamanya Harry Jayawardena has passed away at the age of 82.

title: Govt. to regulate Ayurvedic medicines and cosmetics
byline: Minister of Health Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has directed officials to implement regulations on all products and ingredients used within the Ayurvedic medicine and Ayurvedic cosmetics sector, ensuring strict oversight.

title: Five arrested over Ambalantota triple homicide
byline: Five suspects have been arrested over the triple murder that took place on Sunday (03) in the area of Mamadala in Ambalantota, the police said.

title: Kendrick Lamar’s ‘Not Like Us’ wins record of the year at the 2025 Grammys
byline: Kendrick Lamar has won record of the year for his diss track “Not Like Us” at the 2025 Grammys.

title: Sri Lankan corporate leader Ken Balendra passes away
byline: Sri Lankan corporate leader and executive Deshamanya Kandiah “Ken” Balendra has passed away at the age of 84.

title: Jonty Rhodes back in Sri Lanka: Talks Sri Lankan cricket, ‘big surprise’ hint
byline: South Africa’s cricket legend and fielding maestro, Jonty Rhodes has arrived in Sri Lanka, early this morning (03).

title: 10 Indian fishermen arrested by Sri Lanka Navy
byline: Ten fishermen from Rameswaram, Tamil Nadu, were arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy in the early hours of Monday for allegedly crossing the International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL).

title: Asian markets tumble as Trump’s tariff war escalates
byline: Asian shares slid on Monday morning after US President Donald Trump followed through on his promise to impose tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China.

title: Coconut industrialists urge shift to processed products for export revenue growth
byline: President of the Coconut Milk Manufacturers’ Association, Randeewa Malalasooriya says that the nation’s coconut industry has the potential to bring in USD 2.5 billion as revenue up from the current industry average of USD 850 million.

title: Injunction issued against Buddhist Affairs Commissioner’s decision on ‘Maha Saman Devalaya’
byline: The Court of Appeal today (03) issued an interim injunction preventing the implementation of a decision taken by the Commissioner General of Buddhist Affairs to appoint S.V. Chandrasinghe as the temporary chief custodian of the ‘Sabaragamuwa Maha Saman Devalaya’ in Ratnapura.

title: Sri Lanka’s H’tota Port ready to facilitate vehicle imports
byline: Sri Lanka’s Hambantota International Port’s management expressed readiness to facilitate vehicle imports which have been allowed into the country from February 01, 2025.

title: Suspect arrested with counterfeit vehicles worth Rs. 70 mln as major racket busted
byline: A vehicle salesman known by the alias “Kalawana Polkotuwe Gadda,” who sold vehicles by forging engine and chassis numbers and preparing counterfeit documents, has been arrested by officers of the Walana Central Anti-Vice Task Force.

title: 77th Independence Day celebrations: Special traffic plan in Colombo
byline: The 77th Independence Day celebrations are set to take place tomorrow morning (04), centered around Independence Square and the Independence Avenue area in Colombo.

title: Hostel ordered shut after death of British woman, German couple’s hospitalisation
byline: The Fort Magistrate’s Court has ordered the closure of the Miracle Colombo City Hostel, located at R. A. De Mel Mawatha in Colombo 03, after a 24-year-old British woman staying at the hostel died under emergency circumstances, while a German couple who shared the same room remain hospitalised.

title: Sri Lanka records over 200,000 tourist arrivals in January 2025
byline: With a target set to achieve three million tourist arrivals by the year end, Sri Lanka has welcomed over 200,000 tourists during the first 26 days of this year, surpassing the total arrivals recorded in January last year.

title: Petition seeks to disqualify Minister Ananda Wijepala from Parliament
byline: A petition has been filed with the Court of Appeal seeking an order to invalidate the parliamentary seat of Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala.

title: Beyoncé wins album of the year at the 2025 Grammys for ‘Cowboy Carter’
byline: Beyoncé won album of the year for “Cowboy Carter” at Sunday’s Grammys, delivering her — at last — the show’s elusive top award.

title: Sri Lanka set to launch ‘GovPay’ digital payment platform
byline: As the initial step in the digitalization of government services, the ‘GovPay’ digital payment platform will be launched by the government of Sri Lanka on February 07.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa willing to vacate residence if officially notified - SLPP
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is willing to vacate his official residence if the government officially informs him to do so, says the General Secretary of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Sagara Kariyawasam.

title: Visa delays for Sri Lankans seeking employment in Romania addressed
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) and the Romanian Embassy have jointly organized an awareness program at the Bureau’s headquarters, to address significant delays in issuing visas for Sri Lankans seeking employment in Romania.

title: Suspect arrested with 10 rare conch shells worth over Rs. 1 million
byline: Ganemulla Police have arrested an individual today (03) who was transporting 10 rare conch shells (Valampuri), valued at over Rs. 1 million, concealed in his car with the intent of selling them.

title: 285 prisoners to be pardoned on Independence Day
byline: Over 250 inmates detained at prisons across the island will be released on Tuesday (Feb. 04) in view of the 77th Independence Day of Sri Lanka, the Prisons Department said.

title: 19 killed mostly women in car bomb explosion in northern Syria
byline: A car bomb exploded on the outskirts of a northern Syrian city on Monday, killing at least 19 people, all but one of them women, and leaving more than a dozen wounded, hospital workers said.

title: Colombo hostel incident: German woman dies in hospital as death toll climbs to 2
byline: A German woman, one of the three foreigners hospitalized due to a sudden illness while staying at a hostel on R. A. de Mel Mawatha in Kollupitiya, has passed away in hospital.

title: 10 youths arrested with high-capacity bikes for reckless riding
byline: Ten youths have been arrested for riding motorcycles in a dangerous and reckless manner in the Dehiwala area.

title: Japan provides Rs. 565 mln grant to improve Sri Lanka’s waste management capacity
byline: The Government of Japan has extended a grant of 300 million Japanese Yen (approximately LKR 565 million) to Sri Lanka to enhance waste management infrastructure facilities under the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ Program.
